name: Graph

unions.name: Graph
unions.comment: A directed graph. `(Graph Int String Float)` is a graph that uses `Int`s for identifying its nodes, and lets you store a `String` on each node and a `Float` on each edge.

values.name: edges
values.comment: Get the (from, to) pair for each edge in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> List.List ( comparable, comparable )

values.name: edgesWithData
values.comment: Get the (from, to, Maybe edgeData) pair for each edge in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> List.List ( comparable, comparable, Maybe.Maybe edgeData )

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: filter
values.comment: Create a copy of the graph, only keeping nodes where the predicate function returned True.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> Basics.Bool) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: foldl
values.comment: Fold over the node keys and data in a graph, in order from lowest key to highest key.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> a -> a) -> a -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> a

values.name: foldr
values.comment: Fold over the node keys and data in a graph, in order from highest key to lowest key.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> a -> a) -> a -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> a

values.name: getData
values.comment: Get the data associated with a specific node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Maybe.Maybe data

values.name: getEdgeData
values.comment:
Get the data associated with a specific edge.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`getEdgeData`](Graph-Pair#getEdgeData) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData

values.name: incoming
values.comment: Get the set of incoming edges to a node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Set.Set comparable

values.name: insert
values.comment: Insert a node. Does not overwrite metadata if node already exists.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: insertData
values.comment: Update metadata for a node. Creates the node if it does not already exist.
values.type: comparable -> data -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: insertEdge
values.comment:
Insert an edge between two nodes. Creates any nodes that do not already exist.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`insertEdge`](Graph-Pair#insertEdge) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: insertEdgeData
values.comment:
Insert an edge with some metadata between two nodes. Creates any nodes that do not already exist.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`insertEdgeData`](Graph-Pair#insertEdgeData) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: intersect
values.comment: Create a graph based on the intersection of two graphs. If both graphs have the same node, edge or associated metadata, it will be in the resulting graph. If both graphs have metadata for the same node or edge, the metadata in the left graph will be used.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: isAcyclic
values.comment: Determine if a graph contains any loops or cycles.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Basics.Bool

values.name: isEmpty
values.comment: Determine if the graph is empty.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Basics.Bool

values.name: keys
values.comment: Get the keys for all nodes in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> List.List comparable

values.name: map
values.comment: Apply a function to the data associated with each node in a graph.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data1 -> Maybe.Maybe data2) -> Graph.Graph comparable data1 edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data2 edgeData

values.name: mapEdge
values.comment:
Apply a function to the data associated with each edge in a graph.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`mapEdge`](Graph-Pair#mapEdge) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: (comparable -> comparable -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData1 -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData2) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData1 -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData2

values.name: member
values.comment: Determine if a node identified by a key is in the graph.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Basics.Bool

values.name: memberEdge
values.comment: Determine if an edge identified by a pair of keys is in the graph.
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Basics.Bool

values.name: nodes
values.comment: Get the (key, data) pair for each node in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> List.List ( comparable, Maybe.Maybe data )

values.name: outgoing
values.comment: Get the set of outgoing edges from a node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Set.Set comparable

values.name: partition
values.comment: Partition a graph into two parts. The left one, with the nodes where the predicate function returned True, and right one, where it returned False.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> Basics.Bool) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> ( Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData, Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData )

values.name: postOrder
values.comment: Get a list of all keys in postorder.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> List.List comparable

values.name: remove
values.comment: Remove a node by its key. No-op if node doesn't exist.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: removeData
values.comment: Remove the metadata associated with a specific node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: removeEdge
values.comment:
Remove an edge identified by its source and target keys. No-op if source, target or edge doesn't exist.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`removeEdge`](Graph-Pair#removeEdge) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: removeEdgeData
values.comment:
Remove the metadata associated with a specific edge.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`removeEdgeData`](Graph-Pair#removeEdgeData) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: size
values.comment: Determine the number of nodes in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Basics.Int

values.name: topologicalSort
values.comment: Get a topological sorting of the graph, if the graph doesn't contain any loops or cycles.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Maybe.Maybe (List.List comparable)

values.name: union
values.comment: Join two graphs together. If an edge appears between two nodes in either of the graphs, it will be in the resulting graph. If a node identified by a specific key appears in any of the graphs, it will be in the resulting graph. If both graphs have metadata for the same node or edge, the metadata in the left graph will be used.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: update
values.comment: Update the metadata associated with a specific node.
values.type: comparable -> (Maybe.Maybe data -> Maybe.Maybe data) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: updateEdge
values.comment:
Update the metadata associated with a specific edge.

If you want to pass the edge as a 2-tuple instead, you can use [`updateEdge`](Graph-Pair#updateEdge) from the [Pair](Graph-Pair) module.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> (Maybe.Maybe edgeData -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

name: Graph.Pair
comment:
Graph.Pair provides an alternative api for all functions that in some way take an edge as an argument. All functions in the normal api take edges as two arguments. This module provides the 2-tuple alternatives to those functions. It's basically just doing `uncurry` for you.

@docs getEdgeData, insertEdge, insertEdgeData, removeEdge, removeEdgeData, mapEdge

values.name: getEdgeData
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`getEdgeData`](Graph#getEdgeData).
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData

values.name: insertEdge
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`insertEdge`](Graph#insertEdge).
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: insertEdgeData
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`insertEdgeData`](Graph#insertEdgeData).
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: mapEdge
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`mapEdge`](Graph#mapEdge).
values.type: (( comparable, comparable ) -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData1 -> Maybe.Maybe edgeData2) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData1 -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData2

values.name: removeEdge
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`removeEdge`](Graph#removeEdge).
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

values.name: removeEdgeData
values.comment: Uncurried version of [`removeEdgeData`](Graph#removeEdgeData).
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData

name: Graph.Random

values.name: randomTopologicalSort
values.comment: Generate a random topological sorting of a _directed acyclic graph_. Hangs if the graph contains cycles.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Random.Generator (List.List comparable)

values.name: topologicalSortFuzzer
values.comment: Elm-test fuzzer that generates random topological sortings of a _directed acyclic graph_. Hangs if the graph contains cycles.
values.type: Graph.Graph comparable data edgeData -> Fuzz.Fuzzer (List.List comparable)
